title: Since AD Morde is Not a Thing
body:
Can Morde finally get the huge AD ratio on his Q taken away and have it redistributed?  His attack speed scaling is also fairly over the top now. Since his compensation pass fell through and his rework is not even slotted anymore with plenty of champions ahead of him Mordekaiser could really use this. The new AP item pass could be one of the few buffs Morde has had in a long time after being beaten down over the years by new itemization. 

A portion of this power is going to be wasted if his huge AD ratio is taking away from  his overall power distribution. His attack speed scaling is also outdated. In the past it served two purposes. One was to smooth out his attack animation for his Q so it wasn't so clunky ( especially for a champion plagued with cast times). Secondly it was there to make use of the large AD boost ghost and   hybrid items gave him. The first  reason is sound but there seems to be a bit of overflow for a champion who should really stop at 1 attack a second for a smoother Mace of Spades. The second reason has been dead and buried for quite some time, even more so with the latest change to Morde's ultimate.


The 1.0 AD ratio on the AOE Q and 1.65 ratio on the Single TargeT Q  should be taken away and Mordekaiser's AP ratios should be buffed accordingly. Lastly taking that attack speed scaling and rerouting some of  it to his health growth or health regen would go a long way for a champion meant to fight in melee range for extended periods. It just makes sense at this point.

First I would like to say that's not a fair comparison seeing as Jax and Mordekaiser are two very different attempts at making a hybrid champion. Secondly as far as I know Jax's empower does not play by the same rules as Mordekaiser's Mace of spades.  Morde replaces  his melee attack with a completely new attack  that is converted to magic damage and does not use his base attack damage. It only considers the skill base damage, bonus AD and AP he has built. His power budget is being punished for a stat he has been discouraged to build and that does not use the same rules an On-hit effect like Jax's empower does.

Look at Ekko. Look at Poppy. Look at Kassadin. Look at Fizz. Literally. They all have an on-hit ability and they all technically have AD ratios whether or not it's shown.

Morde is one of the lucky ones where instead of it doing the Physical damage with Magic added ontop, it turns the ENTIRE attack into magic, which is technically better than all of them. Only other one with this is Poppy. All the others do physical damage from their AD part. Removing the total AD portion would end up with them adding in scaling damage to it so it doesn't change anything or they'd have to give it higher base, would would be a nerf since Morde's Q isn't leveled until 2nd since his E is way better. It would total more burst at level 13 with less burst at level 1-9, slowly becoming about the same with the third point, then overcoming at about the 4th and 5th levels into the ability, which likely wouldn't be noticed. 

Honestly, if we wanted to fix Morde, his Q not having an AD ratio would be the last place to look. lol.

It doesn't have total AD. It has nothing to do with the auto attack outside applying the actual melee hit. This has been explained 4 times now I am not doing it again. Mordekaiser's auto attack modifier is unique it has nothing in common with the champions you listed.

Morde is not the monster he once was and quite frankly the stigma that he is OP has always been somewhat unjustified. Outside of the spell vamp debacle that propelled him and vlad into god tier ( much like the Urgot + black cleaver+ new penetration formula fiasco) Morde has not been OP. He can punish a team for being ahead or behind because of ghost and maybe that is still toxic but not OP. He is still the easiest champion to counter by simply walking away yet he has been crowded out of his biggest strength which is damage. Much stronger and more mobile champions have comes along over the 5+ years that  are better at burst or sustained damage than Morde.  His AOE and team fight presence are basically the only things still unmatched.

His rework is a long time coming he deserves to be good at what he does best  at least before the rework comes. It doesn't even need to be a redistribution of the entire 1.65 ratio. A  .6 on AOE Mace of Spades, 1.0 on Isolated Mace of Spades Q,  .4 on Creeping Death , and maybe a .7 on Siphon would go a long way to ramp him up.

An item that would be even better might I add if all that AD was given to his AP ratios instead.  The only thing I have found gunblade to actually be good at is for an old build using:

{{item:3124}} {{item:3146}} {{item:3078}} {{item:3065}} {{item:3068}}   It's painfully expensive but it has two main gimmicks in making morde extremely good in duels and able to solo baron.  AP items make more sense now however and the item revamp will give morde a real bump if his ratios can support it. Morde needs to move away from this design that pulls his in all these directions he can't build for. Smoothing him out to full AP without the potential of multiplying AD items by a large amount as well would do a lot of good in my opinion.

>A portion of this power is going to be wasted if his huge AD ratio is taking away from his overall power distribution.

Why would it be taking up his power budget? He doesn't build any AD. He's been balanced around the expectation that he won't be building any AD. He has the AP ratios he currently has on the assumption that he will not be making any use of the AD ratios. Removing his AD ratios wouldn't be an opening for buffing the AP ratios, because you wouldn't be removing any real-game power from his kit. If he doesn't ever use the AD ratios, it's not power he's actually benefiting from, so there is no reason why it would be taking up his power budget.

If you want his AP ratios buffed, that's fine, but it's completely and utterly unrelated to whatever his AD ratio is. He never builds AD, and he has no potential to build AD, so it doesn't factor into his balance. We could just as easily leave the AD ratio in place and just buff the AP ratios anyway (or find some other method of balance beyond just more damage). Whether we have that AD ratio or not, his balance state will be almost exactly the same.

It actually has a lot to do with the AD ratio which has  always been considered with his overall power budget. If it wasn't there would be no precedent of the nerf on his Q AD scaling when Tri-force Morde was popular. It also would have been irresponsible of the Devs to have give actual mage ratios when hybrid builds were easily hitting 350 AD and AP with ghost back then. Not to mention how easy it was to aquire 30% + critical hit chance. 

He gained a lot of extra damage from the old ghost and items. Many items such as gunblade, the original blood thirster, and tri-force have had balancing impacts on Morde because of his AD  ratio, however most were weeded out during item changes. With no compensation to be heard of ( a time before compensation passes) .It's a symptom of nerfs, itemization changes and system overhauls that leaves a champion like Morde still being punished for the past.

Sadly hybridization feel through the year it was announced and the spell revamps following made things worst. His damage has not been properly balanced. Its why his best damage scaling stats are CDR and Penetration because he was not allowed to scale like other mages. His ratios are so low AP is almost worthless. He's got wasted power in the AD ratio and attack speed scaling and it needs to finally come undone.

For reference of patch notes scaling his isolated AD bonus from 75% to 65% ( which is actually 1.75 to 1.65):

http://lol.gamepedia.com/Mordekaiser_-_The_Master_of_Metal

click on the 1.x notes.

These are all in the past though. They had an impact on Morde once, but right now, his AD ratios aren't factoring into his balance. It's not wasted power, because they've reduced the power in it enough where he isn't actually benefiting from anything the AD ratio gives him.

I mean, I can see the argument for how having an AD ratio that was actually used hurt him in the past, but I don't see anything suggesting that it's continuing to hurt him now. The hybrid builds he used to be able to use have been broken. There isn't any AD item he'd still want to take. He doesn't get AD from the ultimate. Nothing he does interacts with the AD ratio anymore. The AD ratio sees no use, so it isn't part of his power budget. It's already been effectively nullified. It's not the thing holding him back.

Nowadays Morde's AD ratio is like the AP ratio that Graves has on his W. Technically it exists, but in practical terms it could be completely removed without altering the champion's balance at all. That also means that removing it doesn't really open up any options for buffs. Buffs to Morde will be completely independent of the AD ratio on his Q. It's not contributing anything to him, so removing it isn't necessary to make way for buffs.

It isn't all in the past. He was never compensated for having AD taken out his ghost and itemization as well as his 0 need for high scaling attack speed. No ratios were adjusted for this. He hasn't been balanced at all. If you give a champion a large AD ratio and scaling attack speed and then slowly take away all the reasons they was balanced around having extra damage and item options from AD their AP ratio should be readjusted. 

Graves W is not comparable to Morde's Q because Graves was never intended to build AP. His AP ratio is there much like the old Trundle Ult ratio to make sure the champion doesn't scale to well with one state. It's a way to gate a champions power. Riot has done this several times up until the release of Riven. Graves was balanced around not having AP or very little from things like Old WOTA aura, while Morde was not.  Morde was built with AD and AP in mind except now he has lost almost all the his AD options and instead of being converted into full AP for the time being he sits with nerfed values as if he is still balanced around using AD and AP. He no longer gets that 120 + ad that scaled with baron buff and consumables. His spike with ghost is no longer as major.

To really fix morde he needs a rework but for the time being he could be made to do what he does best now and actually deal damage.

> It isn't all in the past.

The value of the AD ratio to his kit is all in the past. He may not have been rebalanced for it being made useless, but it is useless now, and removing it means nothing for his balance. Having an AD ratio isn't the reason he's weak right now. He's weak because Riot thinks his design is a problem, so they aren't seriously buffing him until they figure out a rework. If he didn't have the AD ratio, they'd still be doing exactly the same thing.

>Graves W is not comparable to Morde's Q because Graves was never intended to build AP. 

And current Morde is not intended to build AD. Right now, it is like Graves W. The ratio is just as much of a throwaway. Whatever it was for him in the past, it's worthless right now, and it isn't keeping him weak. He's weak for reasons other than having an AD ratio. It's not taking up any of his power budget.

>To really fix morde he needs a rework but for the time being he could be made to do what he does best now and actually deal damage.

Maybe that's a good option. Maybe not. I don't really care. I'm just saying that getting rid of the AD ratio is completely unrelated to this problem. If he needs higher AP ratios, then he just needs higher AP ratios, and the AD ratio doesn't factor into it. The historical reasons for why he is weak don't matter.

Graves W is a power gate, Morde AD scaling and attack speed was an intended portion of his kit since day one of his release. This was made obsolete and then not compensated for. His numbers are still definitely balanced around the fact that he had access to a large portion of AD. Not balancing for a potential 200+ damage on his Q just for having gunblade and a ghost would have been irresponsible.

 If a champion scales off a certain stat and then that stat is made obsolete with no reassessment of their kit the power budget for their kit has been effected.
